column4: do you have a network / lan and another box you can either log to or lattemt sshing in from?
If possible:  set up a networked logserver, direct your sysklogd to it, and install the netconsole kernel module (this logs kernel panics over the net to the designated host).
http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-netconsole-log-management-tutorial.html
generally, random lock-ups are either hardware or kernel driver issues.
the only other comp i have is my sisters windows xp comp =/
Burn a knoppix disk and boot it with that.
You can turn it into a temporary Linux box, enable netlogging, and see if you can't debug the problem.
... or you can buy a cheap POS for $20-$50 for diagnostic purposes.
minimal used system, natch.
lol, she gets mad at me if i so much as add a chrome extension =/
Dont have the money, i dont even have a comp right now, mine fried :(
booting knoppix changes nothing on her system (now, reformatting the HD while you're running Knoppix is another story).
